task.title: How to Rearrange the Classroom
task.shortdesc: The room can be rearranged to better suit your needs if you prefer a meeting style to the lecture/workshop set up.

taskbody.prereq: Make sure the Mac desktop computers are unplugged before you begin moving the tables.

context.p: When you come in to the room, the default set up is rows of computers side by side on their desks. This set up is good for a lecture or workshop environment because each individual has their own station.

step.cmd: Move unplugged computers off the desks and gently place them on the floor away from the center of the room.
Pull the chairs away from the desks and line them up in front of the computers.
Push the desks into a large rectangle, or smaller squares. You can do this by attaching four desks together to make a small square, or by making 4 separate rows with all of the desks.
Now you can place the computers back on the desks as or if needed, and plug them into the floor outlets.
Place whatever computers that are not being used gently in the cabinet at the back of the room.

taskbody.postreq:
Remember that all AirClassroom guests sign a waiver saying that they are responsible for any damage caused to the classroom and its contents, therefore be careful maneuvering the equipment.
If you feel that you need assistance rearranging, call the maintenance number 765-555-3464.
